cards.name: xenoborg
cards.desc: With a mini-gun in one hand and a rocket launcher in the other, the Xenoborg is a failed hybridization of a Xenomorph and a cyborg.

cards.name: Xenomorph Sentinel
cards.desc: The juices from a Sentinel's neurotoxin gland pair brilliantly with a Pan-Galactic Gargle Blaster.

cards.name: Xenomorph Drone
cards.desc: Rarely seen on the frontline, the Drone is your average worker that lays the foundation of the hive.
cards.rules: {$Hivemind}. For each Xenomorph Drone active on your battlefield, reduce the Summon Cost of Xeno faction Battlefields and Equipment by 1 mana, to a minimum of 1 mana.

cards.name: Xenomorph Hunter (Resin Frontier)
cards.desc: A rare strain of Hunter that prioritizes slaying prey over infecting them.
cards.rules: If this card destroys a creature via combat, you may discard a card in your hand to add a card from your discard pile to your hand, whose summon cost is 2 or less.

cards.name: Xenomorph Spitter
cards.desc: While their acid gland is too dangerous to mix with alcohol (not that it stops the marines), a Spitter's acid is useful for industry as it can melt almost anything with ease.

cards.name: Xenomorph Runner
cards.desc: Running fast and dying faster, the sheer number of Runner corpses from a battle are enough to keep a research facility busy for years.

cards.name: Xenomoprh Rouny
cards.desc: Rouny like go fast

cards.name: Xenomorph Praetorian
cards.desc: The Praetorian is the Queen's royal guard, never seen far from the Queen's chambers.
cards.rules: {$Hivemind}. If you have 2 or more other Xeno cards on your field alongside this card, you may sacrifice 3 Xeno cards from your battlefield, and search for and add Xenomorph Queen to your hand from your deck. Shuffle your deck afterwards.

cards.name: Xenomorph Hivelord
cards.desc: The Hivelord is the last word in construction, capable of building entire hives in a matter of seconds.
cards.rules: {$Hivemind}. {On Tap} (2): Summon a 0/2 Resin Wall counter creature with {$Blocker}.

cards.name: Xenomorph Boiler
cards.desc: The Boiler is a long-range artillery machine, capable of spewing clouds of acid that melt everything in seconds.
cards.rules: {$Hivemind}, {$Long-Ranged}. If this card attacks, it is tapped for an additional turn before it is untapped.

cards.name: Xenomorph Ravager
cards.desc: With large scythe claws for hands, the furious Ravager goes berserk at the sight of fire.

cards.name: Xenomorph Crusher
cards.desc: Extensive testing has revealed that a pulse rifle is unable to penetrate a Crusher's thick armored head.

cards.name: Xenomorph Defender
cards.desc: The Defender's armored head crest makes an excellent makeshift shield.

cards.name: Xenomorph Warrior
cards.desc: Warriors exhibit greater cruelty than other Xeno strains, enjoying snapping a victim's limbs before finishing them off.

cards.name: Xenomorph Queen (Resin Frontier)
cards.desc: The ruler of the hive. Organs from a Queen fetch a high price amongst researchers and less-than-moral surgeons.
cards.rules: {$On Tap} (2): Summon a 1/1 Xenomorph Brood counter creature, with {$Hivemind}.

cards.name: Xenomorph Carrier
cards.desc: Carriers are like the Easter Bunny except the eggs they hide will kill you.

cards.name: Xenomorph Defiler
cards.desc: Instead of utilizing eggs, the Defiler prefers to inject an unknown chemical in their victim, causing a devastating infection.

cards.name: Predalien
cards.desc: No concrete information is available on this elusive creature as no one that has seen it has lived to tell the tale.

cards.name: Xenomorph Shrike
cards.desc: It is unknown why Shrikes are able to lead a Hive, but their hives are always much smaller than a Queen's.
cards.rules: {$Hivemind}. If Xenomorph Queen (Resin Frontier) would be destroyed, you may re-equip Xenomorph Queen (Resin Frontier) on this card instead, once per game.

cards.name: Xenomorph Bull
cards.desc: Popular in illegal rodeos, a Bull's horn can pierce a reinforced wall with ease.

cards.name: Xenomorph Hivemind
cards.desc: Recently discovered to have sapience, this pulsating orb will dig into the earth and rapidly spread resin throughout planets.
cards.rules: {$On Tap} (3): Grant all Xeno faction Creatures on your battlefield +1/+1 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Xenomorph Screecher
cards.desc: The Screecher's screeches are more psychologically damaging than the resulting hearing damage.

cards.name: Xenomorph Creep
cards.desc: This special Hunter strain prioritizes stalking its target. It evolves into a strain of Hunter that is (mercifully) rarely seen aboard space stations.
cards.rules: {$On Tap} (2): This card has immunity to Xeno faction Creatures until the start of your next turn.

cards.name: Xenomorph Wraith
cards.desc: Marines who have the misfortune of meeting a Wraith don't leave a corpse. O-oo r-rah?

cards.name: Xenomorph Gorger
cards.desc: The Gorger, perhaps unsurprisingly, enjoys gorging itself. Primarily on marine blood. In fact, almost exclusively on marine blood.

cards.name: Xenomorph Widow
cards.desc: One of the oddest Xenomorph castes, the Widow is known for birthing near-infinite quantities of mindless broodlings to serve as its minions.
cards.rules: {$Hivemind}. Every End Phase that Xenomorph Widow is active on the battlefield, summon a 1/1 Xenomorph Brood token creature.

cards.name: Xenomorph Warlock
cards.desc: Existing as an abberant Xenomorph geneline, the Warlock defies many of the trends of the other castes- but while it may float and be psychic, one place it doesn't deviate is in its deadliness.
cards.rules: {$Hivemind}. When an opponent plays an Event Card, you may tap Xenomorph Warlock and {$Negate} the Event.

cards.name: Cimex Scuttler
cards.desc: Cimex Scuttlers are known for their extreme speed in rushing to the defense of the hive. Thankfully, once their shell is cracked, they're easy pickings.

cards.name: Cimex Locust
cards.desc: The basic footsoldiers of the Cimex hive, Locusts can number in the thousands per hive, ready to swarm at a moment's notice.
cards.rules: {$Carapace}. If attacking alongside two other Cimex Locusts, Cimex Locust gains +1/0.

cards.name: Cimex Basilisk
cards.desc: Acting as organic artillery, the Basilisk is capable of loosing a potent long ranged blast of heated acid from its tail at any marine unfortunate enough to encounter it.

cards.name: Cimex Goliath
cards.desc: The vanguard of the Cimex hive. It's definitely not afraid to use its head.

cards.name: Cimex Vampire
cards.desc: Vampires function as the main food collectors for the Cimex, draining blood from their victims to bring back to feed the others.

cards.name: Cimex Manticore
cards.desc: With a giant tail and potent venom, the Manticore can kill a marine long after being killed itself.

cards.name: Cimex Tython
cards.desc: The Tythons act as the main broodcarriers of the Cimex Hive, birthing eggs and keeping them warm until they are ready to hatch.
cards.rules: {$Carapace}. {On Destruction}: Summon 2 1/1 Cimex Larvae token creatures.

cards.name: Cimex Ant
cards.desc: The Hive's builders and workers, Ants are crucial to the wellbeing of the Hive... and they pack a mean bite, too.
cards.rules: {$Carapace}. {$On Tap} (2): Summon a 0/3 Cimex Wall token creature with {$Blocker} and {$Taunt}.

cards.name: Cimex Chimera
cards.desc: The ultimate in Cimex warfare. When you hear the sound of beating wings, it's already too late.

cards.name: Cimex Egg
cards.desc: Makes bad omelettes.
cards.rules: {Sacrifice}: Summon a Cimex creature from your hand at halved Summon Cost.

cards.name: Cimex Hive
cards.desc: Cimex Hives are sprawling networks of resinous, chitinous tunnels filled with hex-shaped combs bearing eggs. Also, they're filled with BUGS!
cards.rules: All non-Cimex units get -1/0. All Cimex cards cost 1 less mana to summon, to a minimum of 1 mana.

cards.name: Noxious Blood Infusion
cards.desc: Xenomorph blood is a vicious mix of strong acids and oxidisers, making it extremely dangerous to handle- or be covered in.

cards.name: Encase
cards.desc: Xenomorphs are known to keep their prey for later, usually within nests made of a thick, resinous material that they vomit up. Isn't nature beautiful?

cards.name: Queen's Chamber
cards.desc: In the centre of a xenomorph hive lies the Queen's Chamber, the most important (and well defended) room of the hive.
cards.rules: All Xeno faction cards get +1/+1. All Xenomorph cards cost 1 less mana to summon, to a minimum of 1 mana.

cards.name: Rapid Evolution
cards.desc: No creature proves Darwin right quite like the Xenomorph.
cards.rules: Destroy a Xenomorph Creature on your battlefield, and summon a Xenomorph Creature from your hand at halved cost, rounded up.

cards.name: Defense in Depth
cards.desc: It's easy to underestimate xenomorphs as simple animals, but to do so is a folly- they're perfectly capable of understanding such principles as "more walls, better defense".
cards.rules: Summon 3 0/3 Resin Wall counter creatures with {$Blocker} and {$Taunt}.

cards.name: TGMC Private
cards.desc:
I was a PFC
On a search patrol
Hunting lizards down
It was the Xeno Wars of '65
cards.rules: {$Squad Tactics}, {$Oo Rah}. While fighting a creature with 3 or greater power, TerraGov Private loses 1 power until the end of the combat.

cards.name: Trusty Smokes
cards.desc: Sometimes, the best way to forget the horrors of war is with a quick smoke.
cards.rules: {$On Equip}: Gain the {$Immunity} to Events keyword.

cards.name: Sidearm
cards.desc: Remember: switching to a sidearm is faster than reloading. Shame pistol bullets don't penetrate xeno hide, though.
cards.rules: If an equipment card on your battlefield is destroyed, you may immediately play an equipment card from your hand to replace it (i.e. attach to the same unit).

cards.name: TGMC Smartgunner
cards.desc: Aiming is for nerds- get a smartgun today, and let the bloodbath begin!

cards.name: Recruitment Propaganda
cards.desc: TerraGov needs you to fight (and die) for your planet! Sign up at your local recruitment office today!
cards.rules: Summon 2 1/1 Human Soldier counter creatures with {$Oo Rah}.

cards.name: MRE Menu 7: Crayon Fricassee
cards.desc: An important part of any Marine's balanced diet. Colouring book toilet paper not included.
cards.rules: Give a Soldier-type Creature +2/0 until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Mothic FDF Marine
cards.desc: A soldier of the Mothic Fleet Defense Force, the defensive militia of the Moths. They're an integral part of the anti-xeno coalition.

cards.name: Mothic FDF Sniper
cards.desc: Moths are well suited to the job of sniping, as their natural inclination towards bright lights attracts them to their targets.

cards.name: Mothic FDF Gunner
cards.desc: In order to make use of heavy weapons such as the M56, Mothic Soldiers are issued with a combat E.X.O. which braces the weight across their entire body.

cards.name: TEFL Marine
cards.desc: As part of an arrangement made by the Tiziran Empress, the Tizirans provide a limited expeditionary force to the anti-xeno coalition. While they might fight on the same side as humans there, some wounds haven't quite had time to heal.

cards.name: TEFL Skirmisher
cards.desc: Uniquely amongst the anti-xeno forces, the Tiziran army still places a solid emphasis on close-quarters and hand-to-hand combat. Very few sights are as frightening as a trained Tiziran skirmisher going to work.

cards.name: Ethereal Field Medic
cards.desc: After the integration of the Ethereals into the Terran Federation, a number opted to join up with the TGJMC; amongst these Ethereal soldiers, field medics are a particularly common sight due to a common tenet of medical care amongst the various Ethereal faiths.
cards.rules: {$Oo Rah}. When a friendly Creature card is about to be destroyed, you may sacrifice Ethereal Medic instead to save it.

cards.name: TGMC Black-Ops Operative
cards.desc: While details of TGMC's black-ops during the Xeno Wars are now declassified, at the time these soldiers were among TerraGov's most closely guarded secrets.

cards.name: Fire at Will
cards.desc: Give them the lock, the stock, and two loaded barrels.
cards.rules: Grant all creatures on your battlefield Double Strike until the end of the turn.

cards.name: M42C Anti-Materiel Rifle
cards.desc: An old, yet capable rifle from the human/xeno wars, and one of Waffle Corp's finest weapons before they went out of business. Capable of punching clean through 2 inches of composite armour.

cards.name: Friendly-Fire Incident
cards.desc:
Marine One: Oh man, I just shot Private Marvin in the back.
Marine Two: Why the fuck did you do that?
Marine One: Well I didn't mean to do it, it was an accident!

cards.name: VP78 'Protector' Combat Pistol
cards.desc: A classic Apadyne weapon, which was primarily marketed towards high ranking corpos as a low-profile, high quality self-defense weapon. It also gained notability in the hands of Jack Ryder in the popular action thriller "20 Storeys of Justice", which sparked a wave of interest in the firearm from outside the corporate world, including a number of special forces agents.

cards.name: Cursed Legion Jumptrooper
cards.desc: The 85th Airborne division of the TGMC is known as the Cursed Legion, due to their extreme misfortune in being present at every major defeat sustained by the TGMC during the human/xeno war. Despite their reputation, the unit is known for incredible valour and performance under stress, and those who survived are known as some of the toughest soldiers the TGMC has produced.

cards.name: Bio Toxin 1A
cards.desc: A short-lived experiment by the TGMC, Bio Toxin 1A was intended to be an anti-xeno poison. Unfortunately, it wound up being an anti-everything toxin, and was removed from service after increasing the lethality of friendly-fire incidents by 250%.

cards.name: Cryopod
cards.desc: A common sight for long distance travel prior to the invention of Franklin drives, cryopods fell out of favour as FTL flight became faster and more economical. They're still common on older ships, and typically most modern vessels will still maintain a cryobay in case their FTL engines fail.

cards.name: Hull Breach
cards.desc: In ship-to-ship combat, hull breaches remain the third highest cause of casualties behind battery explosions and friendly-fire incidents.

cards.name: Jaeger XM-02 MCE (EVA Configuration)
cards.desc: The ubiquitous Jaeger Exoskeleton first went into service during the Human-Xeno wars, and has since risen to be standard issue to all TGMC combat personnel. The EVA Module is designed for space combat, being primarily used by the Espatiers Corps.
cards.rules: {$On Equip}: Gain the {$Immunity} to Battlefields keyword.

cards.name: Military Fax Machine
cards.desc: While outdated in most areas, the humble fax machine remains of interest to the military as a secure method of transferring documents.
cards.rules: Search your deck for an event card, and add it to your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Planet-Cracker Munitions
cards.desc: Easily the most powerful artillery load in the TGMC arsenal, consisting of a combination of a high yield thermonuclear 'core' along with several thermobaric explosives designed to cause extreme seismic motion at the point of impact. This produces an extreme man-made earthquake, making the name somewhat of a misnomer. Famously used on Atrakor during the Bombardment of Tizira, giving the moon its signature scar.
cards.rules: Destroy the active battlefield. Destroy all creature cards on both players battlefields.

cards.name: M2 Field-Surgeon Kit
cards.desc: Field-medic kits are much like regular medical kits, but are cooler.

cards.name: TerraGov Peacekeeping Operative
cards.desc: Just like their predecessor organisation, the UN, TerraGov participates in peacekeeping operations across the entirety of inhabited space, wearing their distinctive blue helmets. Their most recent operations on Sprout to pacify the frontier have seen only limited success.
cards.rules: While TerraGov Peacekeeping Operative is active on the battlefield, no Battlefields may be played by the opponent.

cards.name: TerraGov Pilot
cards.desc: Piloting a spacecraft is not an easy feat, let alone an interceptor or fighter, some of the fastest and most nimble sublight vessels mankind has produced.
cards.rules: {$First Strike}. {$On Summon}: Destroy an enemy creature.

cards.name: LV-426
cards.desc: The site of the largest battle of the human-xeno wars, LV-426 is a jungle planet constantly slaked by acid rain, and is only inhabited due to its considerable mineral wealth.

cards.name: Pyrrhic Victory
cards.desc:
6 miles of ground have been won
Half a million men are gone
cards.rules: Destroy all creatures on your battlefield, and deal damage equal to half the total of their resolve, rounded up, to an opposing player's lifeshards.

cards.name: Long Island Citadel
cards.desc: Located in Long Island as part of the Manhattan Capital District, the Citadel is the nexus of TerraGov's Joint Military Command. It's also regarded as one of the most well defended structures in human space, for obvious reasons.
cards.rules: {$On Tap} (3): Grant all creatures on your battlefield First Strike until the end of the turn.

cards.name: Burn 'Em Out
cards.desc: Fire: 1. Perfect organism: 0.

cards.name: ANV-13 "Králové" Combat Robot
cards.desc: Introduced in the late 2400s by Čapek Robotika as a replacement for earlier, more simplistic combat bots, the ANV-13 became a common sight in TerraGov's armies for the next century or so before being ultimately phased out in favour of newer models.
